default: (a)一把{@item 巨斧|phb} 或 (b)任意一把{@filter 軍用近戰武器|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=martial weapon;melee weapon=&}
(a)二把{@item 手斧|phb} 或 (b)任意一把{@filter 簡易武器|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
一套{@item 探索者套裝|phb}，和四把{@item 標槍|phb}

classFeatures.name: 狂暴
entries: 在戰鬥中，你帶著原初的狂怒作戰。在你的回合，你能夠以一個附贈動作進入狂暴。
當處於狂暴時，若你未穿戴重甲，你獲得下列好處：

items: 你在力量檢定和力量豁免中具有優勢。
當你進行一次使用力量的近戰武器攻擊時，你在傷害骰上獲得+2加值。這個加值會隨著你的等級而增加。
你對鈍擊、穿刺、和劈砍傷害具有抗性。

entries: 若你能夠施放法術，則你在狂暴期間無法施放它們或維持法術上的專注。
你的狂暴持續1分鐘。它會在你被擊倒{@condition 昏迷}時提前結束，或若你從上回合到這回合結束時都沒有攻擊一個敵意生物或受到傷害，則狂暴也將提前結束。你也可以在你的回合以一個附贈動作結束你的狂暴﹐
一旦你狂暴的次數達到你當前野蠻人等級所能狂暴的最大次數，你就必須要完成一次長休才能夠再次狂暴。你在1級時可以狂暴二次，3級時三次，6級時四次，12級時五次，以及17級時六次。

classFeatures.name: 無甲防禦
entries: 當你未穿戴護甲時，你的AC等於10 + 你的敏捷調整值 + 你的體質調整值。你可以使用盾牌而仍獲得這個好處。

classFeatures.name: 險境感知
entries: 在2級時，你獲得一種能查覺到周遭異狀的超常感知能力，讓你在躲避危險時掌握先機。你在對抗你所能見的效果時所進行的敏捷豁免中具有優勢，像是陷阱和法術。要獲得此好處，你不能處於{@condition 目盲}、{@condition 耳聾}、或{@condition 無力}狀態。

classFeatures.name: 魯莽攻擊
entries: 從2級開始，你可以拋下防禦以展開不顧一切的猛烈攻擊。當你在你的回合進行你的第一次攻擊時，你可以選擇魯莽地攻擊。這麼做會讓你在該回合間所有使用力量的近戰武器攻擊檢定具有優勢，但直到你的下個回合，所有對你進行的攻擊檢定也將具有優勢。

classFeatures.name: 原初道途
entries: 在3級時，你從可選道途列表中選擇一種形塑你憤怒本質的道途。你的選擇將在3級、6級、10級、和14級時賦予你新的能力。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至4級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 額外攻擊
entries: 從5級開始，每當你在你的回合採取{@action 攻擊}動作，你可以攻擊二次，而非一次。

classFeatures.name: 快速移動
entries: 從5級開始，當你未穿戴重甲時，你的移動速度增加10呎。

classFeatures.name: 道途能力
entries: 在6級時，你獲得一個來自你原初道途的能力。

classFeatures.name: 野性直覺
entries: 從7級起，你的直覺是如此犀利，你在先攻骰中具有優勢。
此外，若你在戰鬥開始時被突襲且未陷入{@condition 無力}狀態，則你可以在你的第一個回合中如常行動。若你這麼做，你必須在該回合進行任何行動前進入狂暴。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至8級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 凶蠻重擊(1顆骰)
entries: 從9級開始，你可以在決定近戰攻擊的重擊所造成的額外傷害時額外骰一顆武器傷害骰。
這個能力會在13級時增加至二顆額外的傷害骰，在17級時增加至三顆額外的傷害骰。

classFeatures.name: 道途能力
entries: 在10級時，你獲得一個來自你原初道途的能力。

classFeatures.name: 頑強狂暴
entries: 從11級開始，你的狂暴讓你即使身受重傷也可以持續戰鬥。若你在狂暴中生命值歸零而沒有立即死亡，則你可以進行一次DC 10的體質豁免。若豁免成功，則改為將你的生命值減少至1。
在你首次使用此能力後的每次，這個豁免檢定的DC都會增加5。當你完成一次短休或長休後，這個豁免檢定的DC將會重置為10。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至12級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 凶蠻重擊(2顆骰)
entries: 在13級時，你可以在決定近戰攻擊的重擊所造成的額外傷害時額外骰二顆武器傷害骰。
這個能力會在17級時增加至三顆額外的傷害骰。

classFeatures.name: 道途能力
entries: 在14級時，你獲得一個來自你原初道途的能力。

classFeatures.name: 持久狂暴
entries: 從15級開始，你的狂暴是如此猛烈，以至於它只會在你陷入{@condition 昏迷}或你選擇結束它時提早結束。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至16級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 凶蠻重擊(3顆骰)
entries: 在17級時，你可以在決定近戰攻擊的重擊所造成的額外傷害時額外骰三顆武器傷害骰。

classFeatures.name: 不屈勇武
entries: 從18級開始，若你力量檢定的總值低於你的力量值，則你可以使用該數值以取代該力量檢定的總值。

classFeatures.name: 屬性值提升
entries: 當你在此職業升至19級時，你可以增加一項自選屬性值2點，或著你可以增加二項自選屬性值各1點。如同平常一樣，你不能透過這個能力將一個屬性值提升至20或以上。
如果你的DM允許使用專長的話，你也可以改為獲得一個{@5etools 專長|feats.html}。

classFeatures.name: 原初勇士
entries: 在20級時，你本身的存在就體現了荒野的力量。你的力量和體質增加4點。你這些數值的上限現在變更為24。

subclassFeatures.name: 狂戰士道途
entries: 對某些野蠻人來說，狂暴是一種達到極致的方式—暴力的極致。狂戰士道途是一條追求鮮血與無拘狂怒的道路。隨著你進入狂戰士的狂暴時，你將在戰鬥的混亂快感中顫慄，捨身忘懷自己的安危。

entries.name: 狂怒
entries: 從你在3級時選擇此道途開始，你可以在狂暴時進入狂怒。若你這麼做，則在你狂暴期間，你可以在這之後的你的每個回合以一個附贈動作進行一次近戰武器攻擊。當你的狂暴結束時，你將承受一級的{@condition 力竭}狀態。

entries.name: 無我狂暴
entries: 從6級開始，你在狂暴期間不會被{@condition 魅惑}或{@condition 恐懼}。若你在進入狂暴時已經被{@condition 魅惑}或{@condition 恐懼}，則該效果將在狂暴期間被壓制。

entries.name: 威懾之姿
entries: 從10級開始，你可以使用你的動作以用你那可怖的姿態恐嚇他人。當你這麼做時，選擇一個距離你30呎內且你所能看見的生物。若該生物可以看見或聽見你，則它必須成功通過一次睿知豁免（DC等同於8+你的熟練加值+你的魅力調整值），否則將被你{@condition 恐懼}直到你的下個回合結束。在後續的回合，你可以使用你的動作使這個效果對被{@condition 恐懼}生物的影響延長到你的下個回合結束。這個效果會在該生物離開你的視野，或離開你超過60呎距離時結束。
若該生物成功通過該豁免檢定，則你在接下來的24小時內都不能再對該生物使用此能力。

entries.name: 復仇
entries: 從14級開始，當你受到來自一個距離你５呎內生物的傷害時，你可以使用你的反應以對該生物進行一次近戰武器攻擊。

subclassFeatures.name: 圖騰勇士道途
entries: 圖騰勇士的道途是一趟靈魂修煉的旅程，野蠻人將接受一種精魂野獸做為嚮導、保護者、和啟發者。在戰鬥中，你的圖騰精魂將超自然的力量灌輸於你，為你的狂暴注入魔法力量。
大部分的野蠻人部落都將圖騰動物視作氏族的一員，因此很少會有人同時擁有兩種或以上的圖騰精魂，盡管仍然存在這樣的特例。

entries.name: 精魂尋訪者
entries: 你追求於與大自然調和知道，使你與動物建立了親密的關係。從你在3級選擇此道途開始，你獲得施放{@spell 野獸知覺}和{@spell 動物交談術}法術的能力，但只能透過儀式施展，參見{@book 第十章|PHB|10|rituals}的描述。

entries.name: 圖騰精魂
entries: 在3級時，當你選擇此道途時，你選擇一種圖騰精魂並獲得它的能力。你必須製造或獲得一個象徵圖騰野獸的獸毛、翼羽、利爪、牙齒、或骨頭的圖騰物體—例如護身符或其他類似的飾品。根據你的選擇，你也可以獲得一些讓人聯想到你圖騰精魂的細微身體特徵。舉例而言，若你擁有熊的圖騰精魂，你可能會有著特別茂盛的毛髮和厚實的肌膚。若你的圖騰為鷹，則你的瞳孔可能變成明亮的黃色。
你的圖騰動物可能會是一個與下列這些有關，但更適合你家鄉的動物。舉例來說，你可以選擇隼鳥或鷲來代替鷹。

entries.name: 熊
entries: 當狂暴時，你對除了精神傷害以外的所有傷害具有抗性。熊之精魂將使你堅韌無匹，無懼於任何打擊。

entries.name: 鷹
entries: 當你狂暴且未穿著重甲時，其他生物對你所進行的藉機攻擊將具有劣勢，且你可以在你的回合以一個附贈動作使用{@action 疾走}動作。鷹之精魂將使你成為能在戰場中自由穿梭的獵殺者。

entries.name: 鹿
entries: 當你狂暴且未穿著重甲時，你的步行速度增加15呎。鹿之精魂將使你格外迅捷。

entries.name: 虎
entries: 當狂暴時，你可以使你的跳遠距離增加10呎，並使你的跳高距離增加3呎。虎之精魂將強化你的跳躍能力。

entries.name: 狼
entries: 當你狂暴時，你的盟友在對任何距離你5呎內且對你有敵意的生物所進行的近戰攻擊檢定具有優勢。狼之精魂將使你成為獵手中的領袖。

entries.name: 獸之形
entries: 在6級時，你獲得一個基於你所選圖騰動物的魔法益處。你可以選擇一個與你在3級時所選相同或不同的動物。

entries.name: 熊
entries: 你獲得熊之力量。你的負載能力（包括最大負重和最大舉重）變為兩倍，且你在拖曳、推動、提舉、或破壞物體時所進行的力量檢定將具有優勢。

entries.name: 鷹
entries: 你獲得鷹之銳目。你可以毫無困難地看見最遠1哩的距離，甚至能辨別出最細微的細節，就如同在檢視距離你不超過100呎的事物一樣。此外，微光光照並不會使你的睿知（{@skill 感知}）檢定承受劣勢。

entries.name: 鹿
entries: 無論是騎乘或徒步，你的旅行步調將變為二倍。只要你未處於{@condition 無力}狀態，則最多十個距離你60呎內的同伴的旅行步調也將變為二倍。鹿之精魂將幫助你行得更快更遠。

entries.name: 虎
entries: 你獲得下列其中二個技能的熟練：{@skill 運動}、{@skill 特技}、{@skill 隱匿}、和{@skill 求生}。貓科精魂將磨練你的求生本能。

entries.name: 狼
entries: 你獲得狼的狩獵敏銳。你能夠以快速步速追蹤其他生物，且你能夠以正常步速隱匿移動。

entries.name: 精魂行者
entries: 在10級時，你可以施放{@spell 問道自然}法術，但只能透過儀式施展。當你這麼做時，你在圖騰精魂或獸之形所選擇的其中一種動物的靈體版本將會出現並傳達你所尋求的資訊。

entries.name: 圖騰調律
entries: 在14級時，你獲得一個基於你所選圖騰動物的魔法益處。你可以選擇一個與你先前所選相同或不同的動物。

entries.name: 熊
entries: 當你狂暴時，任何距離你5呎內且對你有敵意的生物，將在對你或其他擁有此能力生物以外的目標所進行的攻擊檢定中具有劣勢。若一個敵人無法看見或聽見你、或它不會被{@condition 恐懼}，則它將免疫於這個效果。

entries.name: 鷹
entries: 當狂暴時，你將具有等同於你步行速度的飛行速度。這個好處只會在短時間作用；若你在空中結束你的回合且沒有其他東西讓你維持浮空，則你將墜落。

entries.name: 鹿
entries: 當狂暴時，你可以在你的移動期間使用一個附贈動作，以穿過一個體型為大型或更小的生物所佔據的空間。該生物必須成功通過一次力量豁免（DC為8+你的力量調整值+你的熟練加值），否則被擊倒{@condition 伏地}，並受到等同於{@dice 1d12}+你的力量調整值的鈍擊傷害。

entries.name: 虎
entries: 當你狂暴時，若你向一個體型為大型或更小的生物直線移動至少20呎並接著立即對它進行一次近戰武器攻擊，則你可以使用一個附贈動作以對它進行一次額外的近戰武器攻擊。

entries.name: 狼
entries: 當你狂暴時，當你在你的回合以一次近戰武器攻擊命中一個體型為大型或更小的生物時，你可以使用一個附贈動作以將它擊倒{@condition 伏地}。

subclassFeatures.name: 戰狂道途
entries: 在矮人語中以「庫紮爾夫」聞名（意為「斧頭笨蛋」），戰狂是一群追隨著戰爭之神，並選擇了戰狂道途的矮人們。他們特化於穿著笨重的{@item 釘刺甲|scag}投身戰鬥中，用他們的軀體本身打擊敵人，讓自己揮灑戰鬥的狂怒。

entries.name: 限制：限定矮人
entries: 只有矮人可以追隨戰狂道途。戰狂在矮人的社會和文化中占據了特殊的地位。
你的DM可以拔除這個限制以使之更符合戰役設定。這個限制是為了被遺忘的國度而存在，但這也許並不適用於你DM的設定，或他那個版本的國度。

entries.name: 戰狂護甲
entries: 當你在3級時選擇此道途，你將獲得把{@item 釘刺甲|scag}做為武器使用的能力。
當你穿著{@item 釘刺甲|scag}並處於狂暴時，你可以使用一個附贈動作以你護甲上的尖刺對一個距離你5呎內的目標進行一次近戰武器攻擊。若該攻擊命中，該尖刺將造成{@dice 1d4}穿刺傷害。你將力量調整值用於該攻擊的攻擊檢定和傷害骰中。
此外，當你使用{@action 攻擊}動作以擒抱一個生物時，若你的擒抱檢定成功，目標將受到3點穿刺傷害。

entries.name: 魯莽放蕩
entries: 從6級開始，當你在狂暴時使用魯莽攻擊，你也將獲得等同於你體質調整值（最少為1）的臨時生命值。若你在狂暴結束時有任何剩餘的這些臨時生命值，則它們將會消失。

entries.name: 戰狂衝鋒
entries: 從10級開始，當你處於狂暴時，你能夠以一個附贈動作採取{@action 疾走}動作。

entries.name: 尖刺反擊
entries: 從14級開始，當一個距離你5呎內的生物以一次近戰攻擊命中你時，若你處於狂暴，未陷入{@condition 無力}狀態，且正穿著{@item 釘刺甲|scag}，則攻擊者將受到3點穿刺傷害。

subclassFeatures.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian
entries: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. These tribes teach that the warriors of the past linger on in the world as mighty spirits who can guide and protect the living. When barbarians who follow this path rage, they cross the barrier into the spirit world and call on these guardian spirits for aid.
Barbarians who draw on their ancestral guardians fight to protect their tribes and their allies. With the spirits' help, they can hinder their foes even as they strike powerful blows against them.

In order to cement ties to their ancestral guardians, barbarians who follow this path cover themselves in elaborate tattoos that celebrate their ancestors' deeds. These tattoos tell epic sagas of victories against terrible monsters and other fearsome rivals.

entries.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, spectral warriors appear when you rage. These warriors distract a foe you designate and hinder its attempts to evade you. While you're raging, you can use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature you can see within 5 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn or until your rage ends, the chosen creature has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you, and if the creature takes the {@action Disengage} action within 5 feet of you, its speed is halved until the end of its turn.

entries.name: Ancestral Shield
entries: Beginning at 6th level, the guardian spirits that aid you can provide protection for your allies. If you are raging and an ally you can see within 30 feet of you takes bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can use your reaction to transfer your resistance to those damage types to the ally. The resistance applies to the incoming damage. Until the start of your next turn, the ally keeps the resistance and you lack it, unless you also have it from a source other than rage.

entries.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits. Right before you make an Intelligence or a Wisdom check, you can give yourself advantage on the check. You can use this feature three times, and you regain expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: At 14th level, your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to strike your foes. When you or an ally you can see within 30 feet of you is damaged by a melee attack while you're raging, you can use your reaction to cause the attacker to take {@dice 2d8} force damage from the spirits.

subclasses.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian v2 (UA)

subclassFeatures.name: Path of the Ancestral Guardian v2
entries: Some barbarians hail from cultures that revere their ancestors. These tribes teach that the warriors of the past linger on in the world as mighty spirits who can guide and protect the living. When barbarians who follow this path rage, they cross the barrier into the spirit world and call on these guardian spirits for aid.
Barbarians who draw on their ancestral guardians fight to protect their tribes and their allies. With the spirits' help, they can hinder their foes even as they strike powerful blows against them.

In order to cement ties to their ancestral guardians, barbarians who follow this path cover themselves in elaborate tattoos that celebrate their ancestors' deeds. These tattoos tell epic sagas of victories against terrible monsters and other fearsome rivals.

entries.name: Ancestral Protectors
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, spectral warriors appear when you rage. These warriors distract a foe you designate and hinder its attempts to evade you. While you're raging, the first creature you hit with an attack on your turn becomes the target of these warriors. Until the start of your next turn or until your rage ends, that target has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you, and creatures other than you have resistance to the damage of the creature's attacks.

entries.name: Ancestral Shield
entries: Beginning at 6th level, the guardian spirits that aid you can provide protection for your allies. If you are raging and a creature you can see within 30 feet of you takes damage, you can use your reaction and reduce that damage by {@dice 2d8}. When you reach certain levels in this class, you can reduce the damage by more: by {@dice 3d8} at 10th level and by {@dice 4d8} at 14th level.

entries.name: Consult the Spirits
entries: At 10th level, you gain the ability to consult with your ancestral spirits and use them to scout far-off lands. When you do so, you cast the {@spell clairvoyance} spell, without needing a spell slot. Rather than creating a spherical sensor, the spell invisibly summons one of your ancestral spirits to the chosen location. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for the spell. After you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Vengeful Ancestors
entries: At 14th level, your ancestral spirits grow powerful enough to strike foes that dare harm those that you protect. When you use your Spirit Shield Ability to protect a creature damaged by an attack, the attacker takes the same amount of damage that the Spirit Shield protects.

subclassFeatures.name: Path of the Storm Herald
entries: Typical barbarians harbor a fury that dwells within. Their rage grants them superior strength, durability, and speed. Barbarians who follow the Path of the Storm Herald learn instead to transform their rage into a mantle of primal magic that swirls around them. When in a fury, a barbarian of this path taps into nature to create powerful, magical effects.

Storm heralds are typically elite champions who train alongside druids, rangers, and others sworn to protect the natural realm. Other storm heralds hone their craft in elite lodges founded in regions wracked by storms, in the frozen reaches at the world's end, or deep in the hottest deserts.

entries.name: Storm of Fury
entries: When you select this path at 3rd level, choose one of the following options: desert, sea, or tundra. The environment you choose shapes the nature of the storm you conjure when you rage. While raging, you emanate an aura in a 10-foot radius. The effects of this aura depend on your chosen environment.

entries.name: Desert
entries: Any enemy that ends its turn in your aura takes fire damage equal to 2 + your barbarian level divided by 4.

entries.name: Sea
entries: At the end of each of your turns, you can choose a creature in your aura other than yourself. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier. The target takes {@dice 2d6} lightning damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. This damage increases to {@dice 3d6} at 10th level and to {@dice 4d6} at 15th level.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: Any enemy that ends its turn in your aura takes cold damage equal to 2 + your barbarian level divided by 4.

entries.name: Storm Soul
entries: At 6th level, your link to the power of the storm grants you additional abilities based on the environment you chose at 3rd level.

entries.name: Desert
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage and don't suffer the effects of extreme heat.

entries.name: Sea
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage and can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: Tundra. You gain resistance to cold damage and don't suffer the effects of extreme cold.

entries.name: Shield of the Storm
entries: At 10th level, you learn to use your mastery of the storm to protect your allies. While you are raging, allies within your aura gain the benefits of your Storm Soul feature.

entries.name: Raging Storm
entries: At 14th level, the power of the storm you channel grows mightier.

entries.name: Desert
entries: The ground around you becomes like shifting sand. Any enemy that attempts to move more than 5 feet per turn on the ground while in your aura must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failed save, the creature's speed drops to 0 until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Sea
entries: Roaring winds tear through the area around you. Any creature in your aura that you hit with an attack must make a Strength saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength modifier) or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entries.name: Tundra
entries: The air around you coldly slows your foes. The area within your aura is difficult terrain for your enemies.

subclassFeatures.name: Path of the Zealot
entries: Some deities inspire their followers to pitch themselves into a ferocious battle fury. These barbarians are zealots—warriors who channel their rage into powerful displays of divine power.

A variety of gods across the worlds of D&D inspire their followers to embrace this path. Tempus from the Forgotten Realms and Hextor and Erythnul of Greyhawk are all prime examples. In general, the gods who inspire zealots are deities of combat, destruction, and violence. Not all are evil, but few are good.

entries.name: Divine Fury
entries: Starting when you choose this path at 3rd level, you can channel divine fury when you start to rage. If you do so, you become cloaked in an aura of divine power until the rage ends. At the end of each of your turns for that duration, each creature within 5 feet of you takes damage equal to {@dice 1d6} + half your barbarian level. The damage is necrotic or radiant; you choose the type of damage when you gain this feature.

entries.name: Warrior of the Gods
entries: At 3rd level, your soul is marked for endless battle. If a spell would have the sole effect of restoring you to life (but not undeath), the caster does not need material components to cast the spell on you.

entries.name: Zealous Focus
entries: At 6th level, the divine power that fuels your rage can shield you from harm. If you fail a saving throw while raging, you can instead succeed on that saving throw as a reaction. However, doing so immediately ends your rage, and you can't rage again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Zealous Presence
entries: At 10th level, you learn to channel divine power to inspire zealotry in others. As an action, you howl in fury and unleash a battle cry infused with divine energy. Every ally within 60 feet of you gains advantage on attack rolls and saving throws until the start of your next turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Rage Beyond Death
entries: Beginning at 14th level, the divine power that fuels your rage allows you to shrug off fatal blows.

While raging, having 0 hit points doesn't knock you {@condition unconscious}. You still must make death saving throws, and you suffer the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if you would die due to failing death saving throws, you don't die until your rage ends.

subclassFeatures.name: 先祖守衛道途
entries: 有些野蠻人來自有著崇敬祖先文化的部落。這些部落教導著，過往的戰士們將做為強大的精魂徘徊於世，引導並保護著活著的人們。當一個追隨這條道途的野蠻人進入狂暴，他將連繫上精魂靈界，並呼求這些守衛精魂的協助。
那些借用他們先祖守衛的野蠻人們能夠更好地奮戰以守衛他們的部落和盟友。為了牢固他們與先祖守衛的聯繫，追隨這條道途的野蠻人會以歌頌他們先祖事蹟的精巧紋身覆蓋他們的身體。這些紋身描述著他們對抗可怕怪物其他可怖敵人的傳奇勝利。

entries.name: 先祖守護
entries: 從你在3級時選擇此道途開始，靈體勇士將在你進入狂暴時出現。當你狂暴時，你在你回合以一次攻擊命中的第一個生物將成為這些勇士的目標，這些勇士將阻礙該生物的攻擊。直到你的下個回合開始前，目標在任何對你以外的目標所進行的攻擊檢定中具有劣勢，且當目標以一次攻擊命中一個你以外的生物，該生物將對該攻擊所造成的傷害具有抗性。這個效果對目標的影響將在你結束狂暴時提早結束。

entries.name: 精魂之盾
entries: 從6級開始，援助你的守衛精魂可以為那些你所守護的人們提供超自然防護。若你在狂暴中且另一個距離你30呎內且你所能看見的生物受到傷害，你可以使用你的反應以將該傷害減少{@dice 2d6}。
當你在此職業升至特定等級時，你可以減少更多的傷害：10級時改為減少{@dice 3d6}，以及14級時{@dice 4d6}。

entries.name: 問道精魂
entries: 在10級時，你獲得與你先祖精魂交流的能力。當你這麼做時，你可以施放{@spell 卜筮}或{@spell 銳眼術}法術，而無需使用法術位或材料構材。透過這個方式使用{@spell 銳眼術}並不會創造出靈體感應器，而是在所選區域召喚出你的其中一個先祖精魂。你施展這些法術的施法屬性為睿知。
當你透過這個方式施放其中任意一個法術，直到你完成一次短休或長休之前你都不能再使用此能力。

entries.name: 復仇先祖
entries: 在14級時，你的先祖精魂變得強大到足以反擊敵人。當你使用你的精魂之盾能力以減少一次攻擊的傷害時，攻擊者將受到與你精魂之盾所減少的傷害相同數值的力場傷害。

subclassFeatures.name: 風暴先驅道途
entries: 所有野蠻人的體內都懷著狂怒。他們的狂暴將賦予他們卓越的力量、耐力、以及速度。追隨著風暴先驅道途的野蠻人們學會將這狂暴轉變成環繞在他們周遭的原初魔法。當處於這種狂怒中，這個道途的野蠻人將發掘出大自然的力量以創造強大的魔法效果。
風暴先驅通常是那些和德魯伊、遊俠、和其他誓言守護自然之人一同鍛鍊的菁英勇士。而其他風暴先驅則會暫居風暴肆虐之地以磨練他們的技藝，例如世界盡頭的極寒地帶，或最酷熱沙漠的深處。

entries.name: 風暴靈光
entries: 從3級開始，你將在處於狂暴時散發出一道風暴般的魔法靈光。這道靈光將從你身上向全方位延伸10呎，但並無法穿透全掩護。
你的靈光具有一個會在你進入狂暴時被激發的效果，且你可以在你的每個回合以一個附贈動作再次激發這個效果。從沙漠、海洋、和凍原中選擇一種環境。你的靈光效果將根據你所選的環境而有所不同，詳述如下。每當你提升此職業的等級，你都可以變更你所選擇的環境。
若你的靈光效果要求一次豁免檢定，則DC等同於8+你的熟練加值+你的體質調整值。

entries.name: 沙漠
entries: 當這個效果被激發時，所有其他處於你靈光中的生物都將各自受到2點火焰傷害。這個傷害將在你本職業升至特定等級時增加，5級時增加至3點，10級時4點，15級時5點，和20級時6點。

entries.name: 海洋
entries: 當這個效果被激發時，你可以選擇處於你靈光中一個你所能看見的其他生物。目標必須進行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失敗的目標將受到{@dice 1d6}閃電傷害，豁免成功則只受到一半的傷害。這個傷害將在你本職業升至特定等級時增加，10級時增加至{@dice 2d6}，15級時{@dice 3d6}，和20級時{@dice 4d6}。

entries.name: 凍原
entries: 當這個效果被激發時，由於寒冰驚魂將使人適應於苦難，每個處於你靈光中你所選擇的生物將獲得2點臨時生命值。這個臨時生命值將在你本職業升至特定等級時增加，5級時增加至3點，10級時4點，15級時5點，和20級時6點。

entries.name: 風暴之魂
entries: 在6級時，即使你的靈光並未啟動，風暴仍將賜予你好處。這個能力的好處將根據你在風暴靈光中所選的環境而有所不同。

entries.name: 沙漠
entries: 你獲得對火焰傷害的抗性，且你不會受到極端高溫環境的影響（參見地下城主指南的描述）。此外，以一個動作，你可以觸碰一個未被其他人穿戴或攜帶的可燃物體，並使之起火燃燒。

entries.name: 海洋
entries: 你獲得對閃電傷害的抗性，且你可以在水下呼吸。你也獲得30呎的游泳速度。

entries.name: 凍原
entries: 你獲得對寒冰傷害的抗性，且你不會受到極端寒冷環境的影響（參見地下城主指南的描述）。此外，以一個動作，你可以觸碰水並將其中5呎邊長立方體的區域轉變成冰，這塊冰將在1分鐘之後融化。若有生物在這個立方體區域內，則這個動作將失敗。

entries.name: 護盾風暴
entries: 在10級時，你學會如何運用你對風暴的掌控以保護他人。當每個你所選擇的生物處於你的風暴靈光中時，該生物將獲得你在風暴之魂能力中所獲得的傷害抗性。

entries.name: 狂怒風暴
entries: 在14級時，你所引導的暴風力量變得更加強大，襲向你的敵人們。這個能力的效果將根據你在風暴靈光中所選的環境而有所不同。

entries.name: 沙漠
entries: 緊接在一個處於你靈光中生物以一次攻擊命中你之後，你可以使用你的反應以強迫該生物進行一次敏捷豁免。若豁免失敗，該生物將受到等同於你野蠻人等級一半的火焰傷害。

entries.name: 海洋
entries: 當你以一次攻擊命中一個處於你靈光中的生物，你可以使用你的反應以強迫該生物進行一次力量豁免。若豁免失敗，該生物將被擊倒{@condition 伏地}，就好像被海浪沖倒。

entries.name: 凍原
entries: 每當你風暴靈光的效果被啟動，你可以選擇一個靈光中你所能看見的生物。該生物必須成功通過一次力量豁免，否則隨著他被魔法寒霜給覆蓋，他的移動速度將被歸零直到你的下個回合開始。

subclassFeatures.name: 狂熱者道途
entries: 某些神祇激勵他們的追隨者投身於殘酷的戰鬥狂怒中。這些野蠻人被稱作狂熱者—他們是一群將自己的狂暴引導轉變為強大神性力量的戰士們。
在D&D的眾多世界中，有許多神祇都會鼓勵自己的追隨者擁抱狂熱者道途。最著名的幾個例子包括費倫世界的{@deity 坦帕斯}、以及灰鷹世界的{@deity 海克斯托|greyhawk}和{@deity 厄瑞斯努|greyhawk}。一般來說，這些煽動狂熱者的神祇往往掌有戰鬥、破壞、和暴力相關的神職。他們並不全都是邪惡的，但很少是善良的。

entries.name: 神性狂怒
entries: 從你在3級時選擇此道途開始，你可以引導神性狂怒注入你的武器打擊中。當你處於狂暴時，你在你的每個回合以武器攻擊命中的第一個生物將受到等同於{@dice 1d6}+你野蠻人等級的一半的額外傷害。這個額外傷害的傷害類型為死靈或光耀；你在獲得此能力時選擇其中一個傷害類型。

entries.name: 諸神勇士
entries: 在3級時，你的靈魂被印記於加入無盡的戰鬥。若一個法術，像是{@spell 喚醒死者}，只具有能將你從死裡復活的效果（但不能是做為不死生物復活），則施法者在對你施放該法術時並不需要材料構材。

entries.name: 狂熱專注
entries: 從6級開始，那驅使你狂暴的神性力量將能夠保護你。若你在狂暴時於一次豁免檢定中失敗，你可以重骰該豁免檢定，且你必須使用新的擲骰結果。你只能在每次狂暴使用此能力一次。

entries.name: 狂熱之姿
entries: 在10級時，你學會如何引導神性力量以激發他人心中的狂熱。以一個附贈動作，你釋放出一陣充滿神性能量的戰吼。你選擇最多十個距離你60呎內且能聽見你的其他生物，直到你的下個回合開始前，他們在攻擊檢定和豁免檢定中具有優勢。
一旦你使用此能力，直到你完成一次長休之前你都不能再使用它。

entries.name: 怒不畏死
entries: 從14級開始，那驅使你狂暴的神性力量將讓你得以無視最致命的打擊。
當你狂暴時，生命值被歸零並不會將你擊倒{@condition 昏迷}。你仍然必須進行死亡豁免，你在生命值為零的情況下受到傷害時仍會承受正常的效果。然而，若你因為死亡豁免失敗而將要死亡，則你直到狂暴結束前都不會死亡，且你只有在那個時候生命值仍然為零時才會死亡。
A tall human tribesman strides through a blizzard, draped in fur and hefting his axe. He laughs as he charges toward the frost giant who dared poach his people's elk herd.
A half-orc snarls at the latest challenger to her authority over their savage tribe, ready to break his neck with her bare hands as she did to the last six rivals.
Frothing at the mouth, a dwarf slams his helmet into the face of his drow foe, then turns to drive his armored elbow into the gut of another.

These barbarians, different as they might be, are defined by their rage: unbridled, unquenchable, and unthinking fury. More than a mere emotion, their anger is the ferocity of a cornered predator, the unrelenting assault of a storm, the churning turmoil of the sea.

For some, their rage springs from a communion with fierce animal spirits. Others draw from a roiling reservoir of anger at a world full of pain. For every barbarian, rage is a power that fuels not just a battle frenzy but also uncanny reflexes, resilience, and feats of strength.

entries.name: Primal Instinct
entries: People of towns and cities take pride in how their civilized ways set them apart from animals, as if denying one's own nature was a mark of superiority. To a barbarian, though, civilization is no virtue, but a sign of weakness. The strong embrace their animal nature—keen instincts, primal physicality, and ferocious rage. Barbarians are uncomfortable when hedged in by walls and crowds. They thrive in the wilds of their homelands: the tundra, jungle, or grasslands where their tribes live and hunt.

Barbarians come alive in the chaos of combat. They can enter a berserk state where rage takes over, giving them superhuman strength and resilience. A barbarian can draw on this reservoir of fury only a few times without resting, but those few rages are usually sufficient to defeat whatever threats arise.

entries.name: A Life of Danger
entries: Not every member of the tribes deemed "barbarians" by scions of civilized society has the barbarian class. A true barbarian among these people is as uncommon as a skilled fighter in a town, and he or she plays a similar role as a protector of the people and a leader in times of war. Life in the wild places of the world is fraught with peril: rival tribes, deadly weather, and terrifying monsters. Barbarians charge headlong into that danger so that their people don't have to.

Their courage in the face of danger makes barbarians perfectly suited for adventuring. Wandering is often a way of life for their native tribes, and the rootless life of the adventurer is little hardship for a barbarian. Some barbarians miss the close-knit family structures of the tribe, but eventually find them replaced by the bonds formed among the members of their adventuring parties.

entries.name: Creating a Barbarian
entries: When creating a barbarian character, think about where your character comes from and his or her place in the world. Talk with your DM about an appropriate origin for your barbarian. Did you come from a distant land, making you a stranger in the area of the campaign? Or is the campaign set in a rough-and-tumble frontier where barbarians are common?

What led you to take up the adventuring life? Were you lured to settled lands by the promise of riches? Did you join forces with soldiers of those lands to face a shared threat? Did monsters or an invading horde drive you out of your homeland, making you a rootless refugee? Perhaps you were a prisoner of war, brought in chains to "civilized" lands and only now able to win your freedom. Or you might have been cast out from your people because of a crime you committed, a taboo you violated, or a coup that removed you from a position of authority.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a barbarian quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Strength, followed by Constitution. Second, choose the {@background outlander} background.
I have witnessed the indomitable performance of barbarians on the field of battle, and it makes me wonder what force lies at the heart of their rage.

The anger felt by a normal person resembles the rage of a barbarian in the same way that a gentle breeze is akin to a furious thunderstorm. The barbarian's driving force comes from a place that transcends mere emotion, making its manifestation all the more terrible. Whether the impetus for the fury comes entirely from within or from forging a link with a spirit animal, a raging barbarian becomes able to perform supernatural feats of strength and endurance. The outburst is temporary, but while it lasts, it takes over body and mind, driving the barbarian on despite peril and injury, until the last enemy falls.

It can be tempting to play a barbarian character that is a straightforward application of the classic archetype—a brute, and usually a dimwitted one at that, who rushes in where others fear to tread. But not all the barbarians in the world are cut from that cloth, so you can certainly put your own spin on things. Either way, consider adding some flourishes to make your barbarian stand out from all others; see the following sections for some ideas.

entries.name: Personal Totems
entries: Barbarians tend to travel light, carrying little in the way of personal effects or other unnecessary gear. The few possessions they do carry often include small items that have special significance. A personal totem is significant because it has a mystical origin or is tied to an important moment in the character's life—perhaps a remembrance from the barbarian's past or a harbinger of what lies ahead.

A personal totem of this sort might be associated with a barbarian's spirit animal, or might actually be the totem object for the animal, but such a connection is not essential. One who has a bear totem spirit, for instance, could still carry an eagle's feather as a personal totem.
Consider creating one or more personal totems for your character—objects that hold a special link to your character's past or future. Think about how a totem might affect your character's actions.

entries.caption: Personal Totems
rows: A tuft of fur from a solitary wolf that you befriended during a hunt
Three eagle feathers given to you by a wise shaman, who told you they would play a role in determining your fate
A necklace made from the claws of a young cave bear that you slew singlehandedly as a child
A small leather pouch holding three stones that represent your ancestors
A few small bones from the first beast you killed, tied together with colored wool
An egg-sized stone in the shape of your spirit animal that appeared one day in your belt pouch

entries.name: Tattoos
entries: The members of many barbarian clans decorate their bodies with tattoos, each of which represents a significant moment in the life of the bearer or the bearer's ancestors, or which symbolizes a feeling or an attitude. As with personal totems, a barbarian's tattoos might or might not be related to an animal spirit.
Each tattoo a barbarian displays contributes to that individual's identity. If your character wears tattoos, what do they look like, and what do they represent?

entries.caption: Tattoos
rows: The wings of an eagle are spread wide across your upper back.
Etched on the backs of your hands are the paws of a cave bear.
The symbols of your clan are displayed in viny patterns along your arms.
The antlers of an elk are inked across your back.
Images of your spirit animal are tattooed along your weapon arm and hand.
The eyes of a wolf are marked on your back to help you see and ward off evil spirits.

entries.name: Superstitions
entries: Barbarians vary widely in how they understand life. Some follow gods and look for guidance from those deities in the cycles of nature and the animals they encounter. These barbarians believe that spirits inhabit the plants and animals of the world, and the barbarians look to them for omens and power.

Other barbarians trust only in the blood that runs in their veins and the steel they hold in their hands. They have no use for the invisible world, instead relying on their senses to hunt and survive like the wild beasts they emulate.
Both of these attitudes can give rise to superstitions. These beliefs are often passed down within a family or shared among the members of a clan or a hunting group.
If your barbarian character has any superstitions, were they ingrained in you by your family, or are they the result of personal experience?

entries.caption: Superstition
rows: If you disturb the bones of the dead, you inherit all the troubles that plagued them in life.
Never trust a wizard. They're all devils in disguise, especially the friendly ones.
Dwarves have lost their spirits, and are almost like the undead. That's why they live underground.
Magical things bring trouble. Never sleep with a magic object within ten feet of you.
When you walk through a graveyard, be sure to wear silver, or a ghost might jump into your body.
If an elf looks you in the eyes, she's trying to read your thoughts.
